name: A Monadic Functor that is not an Equivalence
definition: The forgetful functor $U: \mathbf{Ab} \to \mathbf{Set}$ from abelian groups to sets is monadic (by Beck's monadicity theorem), but it is not an equivalence since it is neither full nor essentially surjective.
comments: Monadic functors create algebras for a monad but need not be equivalences.
